Section.Catchline: Relationship of Department of Revenue to United States central authority.

SectionBody.Text: The Department of Revenue is recognized as the agency designated by the United States central authority to perform specific functions under the convention.

Note.Text: Section 61, ch. 2011-92, created s. 88.7031, to be effective on a date contingent upon the provisions of s. 81, ch. 2011-92. Section 81, ch. 2011-92, provides that “[e]xcept as otherwise expressly provided in this act, this act shall take effect upon the earlier of 90 days following Congress amending 42 U.S.C. s. 666(f) to allow or require states to adopt the 2008 version of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, or 90 days following the state obtaining a waiver of its state plan requirement under Title IV-D of the Social Security Act.”
